characters: AT THE FAR END OF THE MOTEL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hot summer night. The flesh district - hookers working th sidewalks, stopping cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MIKE REILLY, 20s, paces a corner, restless, looking for action ... wet hair, three-day beard, trenchcoat, sneaker heat-seeking weary eyes. He flashes a wad of bills in an effort to get some attention... no one notices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Across the street, BILL RICE, 50's, a ragged transient, strolls over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what the problem is, kid?   You're too ugly to get propositioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look who's talking, old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, it's a quiet night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice starts away.   Reilly pauses, then trudges after him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice and Reilly pull donuts and coffee out of a bag, talk with their mouths full as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next week we work the park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta get back on top.   Get off the sleaze detail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You will, one day at a time.   I'll be old and grey when it happens...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a grin, pass a BAG LADY who wears a pie-tin cr holding her hand out to a PIMP getting into a Cadillac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small gift, sir, for the Queen ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Pimp ignores her, screeches off. The Bag Lady pulls o a pad, adds his license number to a list, glances up at R and Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAG LADY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I keep a record, see? They don't pay, I don't forget.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice fishes some change out of his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here you go, your Highness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAG LADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, officer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes her shopping cart away. Rice and Reilly look a each other, crack up, surprised she knew he was a cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what'll you do? After they give you the gold watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell, I got a gold watch... it just don't work. Maybe they'll give me a new fishing pole, or something useful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't fish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How hard can it be? The grand kids been buggin' me about taking them camping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY You outta the city... that's a fish out of water. What's with all this family talk lately, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE One of these days you're gonna get tired of fighting the shit. When that happens, you'll wish you had family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.   I got close but it never woulda worked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop beside a dirty, beat-up Studebaker parked in th alley, climb in, Reilly behind the wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cluttered with debris - clothes, boxes, personal items. Reilly jiggles the ignition - the engine coughs and sputt finally turns over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE Why don't you just shoot it and put it out of its misery?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY What are you talking about, it's purring like a kitty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE I thought you said what's-her-name's brother was going to fix it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY She didn't work out, had to cut her loose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE What was it this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY She wanted to cook me breakfast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The White Van appears up ahead and turns into a seemingly deserted building's garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Rice exchange a glance as they wait to see lig come on in the building. They don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two flashlight beams criss cross through the windows of t building briefly, then disappear. They hear a brief heate argument, that is cut short abruptly. Then silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.) C'mon, let's check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're vice, I didn't see no pimps or hookers in that van. But if you're so gung-ho, we'd best call it in for some back-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, let's just take a look-see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly jumps out and heads for the building.   Rice rolls eyes, follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A huge, old, battered machine shop. Spooky darkness, dead quiet. Moonlight filters in through dirt-smeared windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door CREAKS as Reilly and Rice slip in, stop, eyes sc Nothing.   Just rows of glistening machines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice gestures for Reilly to spread out. They head in, footsteps echoing, shadows washing over them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still nothing...deeper, deeper... then, glancing over, Re sees a shape hiding behind a machine. He steps towards it The shape whirls - a beautiful spitfire of a GIRL with piercing blue eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to bolt. Reilly grabs her. She struggles, pulls knife, slashes his arm, drawing blood through his trenchc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow!   Son-of-a-bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches her full force in the face - she collapses, knocked out cold. Rice rushes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, just a nick ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, over Reilly's shoulder, Rice sees a dark SILHOUETTE emerging from behind a machine. Rice draws his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freeze!   Police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reilly whirls, the Silhouette raises a Mac-11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice shoves Reilly aside as the Silhouette OPENS FIRE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Diving for cover, Reilly flings back his trenchcoat, whip out his 9mm and RETURNS FIRE at the Silhouette, blowing t shit out of windows behind, sparks showering off machines

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence for an instant, Reilly looks for Rice and finds h bleeding to death on the floor nearby - he is completely exposed to the line of fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Silhouette and another FIGURE OPEN FIRE on Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN, 40s, crazy-brilliant, manic eyes... and one of his pale, sweaty, wearing an EARRING, 30s, continue the barra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan fires ONE SHOT at a time at Rice, deliberately aimin not to kill him, trying to flush Reilly out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice screams as BULLETS RIP into his legs. Reilly tries t reach him but can't, shots forcing him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dark-eyed man with a BEARD appears in the b.g. and stea towards Reilly from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly' face is in agony as Rice moans in pain. He glance urgently from the gunmen to the exit behind them, to The lying next to him -- what's keeping them there? Obviously The Girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stirs. Desperate, Reilly grabs her by the hair, shove his 9mm to her head. Using her as a shield, he drags her front of Rice to protect him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (to gunmen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan's eyes flare. He steps out into the open, gun aimed Rice, eyes locked murderously on Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly cocks his hammer, fingers trembling.   The Girl stiffens, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard emerges behind Reilly. Deadly silent, he raises an automatic, trying to get a clear shot between machines...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, the girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly whirls, sees Beard, shrinks back to stay covered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EARRING (to Swan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta get outta here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (to Swan)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell them to drop it - now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A deadly stalemate.   Faraway SIRENS WAIL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have no idea how sorry you're going to be. (to The Girl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard smolders, Earring sweats. Keeping their guns up, th three men grab tool bags, work their way to the alley doo and slip out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The moment they're gone, Reilly quickly handcuffs The Gir a machine, kneels, cradles Rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time... one day at a time, kid...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice takes Reilly's hand and pats it on his wristwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's all I got... it's yours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It don't work-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICE (grinning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't that a shit--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rice's eyes go blank, he exhales his last breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly winces, eyes welling up. His gaze moves at the Gir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl stares uncomfortably, a blink of sympathy steali past her hard exterior ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking numb, out of place, Rice's blood still on his trenchcoat, Reilly walks in, weaves through a chaos of ringing phones, overworked cops, suspects being booked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops look up, whisper about him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning a corner, Reilly bumps into a bulldog of a cop, HARRY, hustling The Girl out of a booking room. She's got shiner where Reilly hit her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl and Reilly make eye contact, intimate somehow, a flash of vulnerability and fear in The Girl's face...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Reilly, Captain's looking for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly snaps out of it, continues on.    Reilly nods as H hustles the girl away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind his desk, a work-weary captain, WINTERS, 50s, suck coffee as he grills ARTIE PLUCHINSKY, 40s, a slick suit-a tie homicide detective.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prints?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the ballistics report?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lab's backed up, we're still waiting for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, what the hell happened out there?   Why didn't you call for back-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (at a loss, sad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, I--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly looks at his watch (we notice he's now wearing Ric watch). He taps it, listens to see if it's ticking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (contГ­d) (softening)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dammit, Rice was a good man,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to work this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUCHINSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're vice, not homicide. Besides, you don't have the experience and you're too personally involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But sir--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the rules. You're off the street `til I.A.D. clears the investigation. Now go home and clean yourself up, get some rest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry barges in, dumps a bag of personal effects on the d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't talk. Look at this shit, no I.D., nothing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly picks up a twisted plastic-wire bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bracelet she was wearing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like the stuff my dad used to use to blow up tree stumps back in Scranton.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe she knows your old man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly sears into Pluchinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it down to the Bomb Squad, Artie-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters eyes him for a beat, relents...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, kid.    Run this down to the Cave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly spins and exits quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Emerging from a dingy back staircase, Reilly enters a hal and moves to a door a door marked "BOMB SQUAD."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly enters into another world - a dungeon cluttered wi bomb paraphernalia, defusing equipment, a dog house, ping pong table, Sheryl Crow pin-up, Chicago Bears posters, Ya Arafat dartboard, a photo-shrine to dead Bomb Squaders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A plain, fresh-faced assistant, BEV, 30s, looks up from h computer station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for the Bomb Squad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Reilly, vice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There out on a call, perhaps I can help you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 2600 block of Lakefront.   A limousine.   But, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly sprints out.   Bev tries to finish but he's gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Studebaker coughs and smokes in and out of traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A young, uniformed police OFFICER stops Reilly in front o cordoned-off section of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (flashes badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bomb Squad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer nods and moves the barricade out of the way, Reilly hits the gas, rumbles through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Studebaker swings past a fire truck, an ambulance, an two squads cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two OFFICERS stand near a building with a worried BUSINES and his CHAUFFEUR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly parks 50 yards from a limo stopped in the middle o the street. A Bomb Squad van and sleek black Harley David parked beyond it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly hops out, heads cautiously for the limo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH, 50s, a barrel-chested ex-football player is on his hands and knees looking under the limo. Red rubber ball i hand, Hawaiian shirt half-tucked in, he leads around an equally scruffy Labrador Retriever, SCHNOZ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smell anything, Schnoz?    Me, neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J., 20s, a country boy inspects the open trunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS, 40s, clean-cut, straight-laced, easy-going smile, brilliant leader of the team, steps lightly around the op driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH (contГ­d) (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schnoz, come here, boy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhh, I hear something....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly stands off 25 feet.    Glass notices him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the heck're you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You the Bomb Squad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we're terrorists, stay back or we'll blow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're a bit busy at the moment, I'll give you a statement in a few minutes if we're still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (flashes badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, Vice. I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Pooch step lightly to the rear of the limo wher T.J. has discovered a shoebox wedged next to the spare ti T.J. leans down, puts his ear to it, nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ticker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch lifts up Schnoz and holds him over the trunk.    Sc sniffs the shoebox, whines.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schnoz says it's loaded.    Good boy, Schnozzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch lowers Schnoz back to the ground throws him the red ball, and trots back to the van, climbs up inside and sit watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright boys, look close.   Let's assess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, Pooch and T.J. take a beat just to look at the shoebox. Then, Glass nods for Reilly to move away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly takes a few steps back, watching as the team works together - Glass in charge - a psychic connection between them as they pass tools back and forth like surgeons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadaya think, "boy" or "girl"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass puts on magnifying spectacles -- precise, organized detail freak as he uses a wooden probe to test the box fo wires, sensors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the others watch, Glass rubs his fingertips ritualistically and carefully eases the top off the box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches in...   Grabs something...   Slowly pulls it o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a Mickey Mouse alarm clock doll, a clump of unlit firecrackers taped between Mickey's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bomb Squaders whoop and howl - all except Pooch who p out a pack of Tums, shoves half of it in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a "girl" !

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all crack up, hysterical.   Reilly stares in disbeli these guys are nuts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the b.g., the Officers finish getting a statement from Businessman as the still-worried Chauffeur inspects the l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. and Pooch load their equipment into the van as Glass fills out paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy's wife must be pretty pissed off to play a trick like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No shit.   I better send Meg flowers just in case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. and Pooch share a laugh as Reilly approaches...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's in charge here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch points to Schnoz.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make an appointment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly holds up the bracelet.    Glass takes it, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you get this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off a girl's wrist.    A suspect...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High-grade det cord. This girl, either she's got strange taste in jewelry or she's into serious demolition.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass whips out a blasting cap from his utility belt, cut off a piece of the bracelet, plugs it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fire in the hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass tosses it into a sewer drain. A beat, then a small EXPLOSION, smoke billows out of the gutter drain. The nea Officers jump, alarmed. The Bomb Squad guys laugh. Glass waves to the Officers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that. (to Reilly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's an inch of the stuff, imagine what the whole thing'd do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs back the bracelet, turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey wait a minute-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly jogs back to his Studebaker, climbs in and roars o in a cloud of dirty smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vice... Jesus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'd be some explosive pussy he's got his hands on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and T.J. share a laugh as Glass shakes his head, cl on his Harley. The others pile into the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass kicks-starts his hog and rumbles away, van followin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thin crowd of day-time drinkers. Earring walks in, moves a booth where Swan and Beard are eating. Earring pulls ou Gallois (French) cigarette, lights up from a book of matc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're holding her downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the cop?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earring shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'd let me waste him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if she talks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we split town. Come back to this job when things cool. We've got other contracts - Denver, Seattle...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan slams his fist down, spilling food.     No one in ba looks up from their drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want her back and we do the job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we agreed, the personal can't interfere with the professional.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Besides, we're on a schedule and the cops won't let her go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless we make them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earring stares uneasily. Swan and Beard look up, freeze. pair of PATROL COPS are heading directly towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earring reaches under his jacket...   Swan grabs Earring' arm, calming him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Cops keep coming, then at the last moment, they veer and slide into a booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan nods, they get up and casually slip outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly hurries in, interrupts Winters and Pluchinsky talk over Pluchinsky's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OFFICER shouts from across the room, holding up a phon

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, line one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Reilly) I thought I told you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says it's important, something about the Rice shooting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters snatches up the nearest phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens, facial expression changing, getting tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He punches an intercom button - the whole room stops, loo up, as Swan's voice comes over the squawk box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said release the girl or alot of people are going to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters signals frantically for the call to be traced -- spring into action.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN'S VOICE (contГ­d) (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's exactly two o'clock. If she's not released in one hour, people die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, what do you mean--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click, the line goes dead.    Winters slams down the phon chance of a trace.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUCHINSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A ticking bomb...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (holds up bracelet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's detonation cord, for a bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a bluff. The guy's full of crap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't take the chance. Ring down to the Bomb Squad. I want them on alert.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goddamit, Reilly--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I saw these guys, I can i.d. them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you're anxious to get back but... just stay out of homicide's way or I'll have you classifying fingerprints, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly takes off, Pluchinsky glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. is hunched over a twisted mess of wires, untangling them.   Pooch taste-tests dog biscuits for Schnoz, then f them to him, as he talks to his wife on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass is dissecting the Mickey Mouse clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, honey, I'm fine. Yeah, well, you're welcome. You deserve flowers more often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev glances longingly at T.J. as she gives Glass a neck r

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev, you're the greatest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. winks as Bev turns away, hard to get.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, that's the guy-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just got a bomb threat upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This gets everyone's attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop was killed last night interrupting a robbery. One of the gang was grabbed, a girl. The one I told you about with the detonation cord. Well, her friends just called in, they're threatening to waste people unless she's released in the next hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, let's check it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can start in the area where the robbery occurred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vice cop on a homicide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain assigned me to assist you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assist?   What the hell you know about tickers anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy, guys. (to Reilly) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, nothing personal, but you can't just waltz in here and expect to join the team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you need us, you love us, when you don't, we're shunned by the rest of the department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got one hour.     Are you coming or not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Squad just stands there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly walks out.   The guys look at each other.   Glass at the bracelet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those vice cops, around all that pussy, so pent up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev smirks at T.J.'s language, he lowers his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH (to Glass)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call upstairs, see what you can find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (re: bracelet)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J., run a trace on this, see if you can pin down where it came from. Whoever these people are, let's hope they're all talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly's Studebaker is parked next to the machine shop building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly enters and slowly re-walks his steps from the shoo out, pausing over the chalk outline of Rice's body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two FORENSICS OFFICERS silently comb over the crime scene

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly pauses, sadness overwhelming him. One of the Offic nods at him, he has to turn away as the emotions come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophisticated detonation equipment and weapons cover the beds. Beard scowls, Earring sweats as Swan puts the finishing touches on a computerized briefcase bomb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twenty after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan, it's no use. Look, we can still make Houston--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets a timer, closes the briefcase, smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sleazy area. Briefcase in hand, Earring slips out and ble into pedestrian traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earring walks on, just a man with a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earring slows and passes a bus stop where a group of gigg TEENAGE GIRLS are waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He notices a raven-haired KNOCKOUT going into the pub up ahead. He grins and follows her in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A trendy Irish Pub, a sparse lunch crowd. Earring enters, spots the Knockout ordering a drink at the bar, slides on stool next to her, and deposits the briefcase on the floo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, beautiful, can I buy you some bangers and mash? Pint of Guiness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him a once-over, turns up her nose, nods a `tha to the Bartender delivering her white wine. Earring's smi doesn't change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EARRING (cont.) Last chance. You know, even the smallest choices in life could change everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck off, pal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earring grins and shrugs an `oh well'. He slides off the stool, steps back, and exits... leaving the briefcase beh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earring walks out and strolls off. He checks his watch, picks up the pace. He disappears around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cars pass.   People stroll by.   Nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ordinary scene on an ordinary day.     The silence is screaming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly - the bar EXPLODES. A FIREBALL BURSTS OUT the fr window, showering the street with wood and BROKEN GLASS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaotic aftermath of the bombing... sirens, flashing red lights. Police hold back onlookers, Firemen clean up, Paramedics carry corpses and moaning Victims out of the charred, smoking ruins, into waiting ambulances.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A black-and-white tears up. Capt. Winters leaps out, push through to a dirt-covered FIRE CHIEF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight dead, so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters looks grim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly SCREECHES up in his Studebaker, jumps out, pushes through, flashes his badge, enters the police zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops as he sees a bloody FEMALE VICTIM being loaded i an ambulance. Suddenly a voice snaps him out of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly faces him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUCHINSKY (cont.) You're offsides. Beat it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly ignores them, starts towards the ruins.    Pluchin shoves him back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUCHINSKY (cont.) I said get the fuck outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You touch me again and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUCHINSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what, you'll shoot me? Hey, don't mistake me for one of your partners, I'd like to make retirement in one piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pluchinsky starts to laugh as Reilly pops him once hard i the face. Pluchinsky staggers backwards, grasping his bleeding nose. Reilly is ready for more as Pluchinsky sta at him. They exchange a few body shots before several cop swarm in and pull them apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters hustles over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUCHINSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Son-of-a-bitch... my nose...   This fuck-up is interfering with-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, what're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I told you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's with us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all turn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and T.J. stand there, soot-smeared, wearing utility belts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We asked him to come.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, he's helping us work up a profile on this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hope you don't mind, Captain, might help us catch these guys that much sooner. (to Reilly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly looks at the Captain awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly marches after Glass and T.J., leaving Pluchinsky fuming, holding closed his bloody nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUCHINSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm filing charges against that mother-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can it, Pluchinsky. And shove some cotton up your nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly follows Glass and T.J., bewildered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was-?   Why...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That cop who bought it... you didn't tell us he was your partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've lost brothers too, we know what that's like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get something straight. We're doing you a favor. You're not exactly a guy we want around explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't bumper cars, it's brain surgery. You wanna work with us, you do it our way, understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now wait just a fucking-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be cool around my men, they don't trust strangers. And try not to swear so much, it's unattractive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly glares, tongue-tied, as they walk past the Bomb Sq van and Glass' Harley, enter the wreckage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoky hell. Two Firemen drag out a fire hose. Glass, T.J. and Reilly approach a taped-off area where Pooch is on hi hands and knees, wet and dirty as he searchs for clues. Schnoz sits nearby, red ball in his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I'm Glass.   This is T.J., and Pooch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (offering dirty hand) Uh-huh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly avoids the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That there's Schnoz, mascot and ace bomb sniffer. Say hi, Schnozzie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schnoz ignores them, sniffing a charred beam in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. points out burn patterns to Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flame racer, partial P.C.L. See this wave pattern? Definitely self-contained.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch sniffs dirt, tastes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nitro, dash of Semtrex, vegetable oil ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What kind of bomb was it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't use the b-word.      Bad luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you're the "Device Squad"... and you defuse "devices"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Treat.    We treat devices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (amused)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else I should know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't push it, slick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Schnoz whines and paws at something under the beam.   The scramble over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, can you move it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch positions himself like a weight-lifter preparing to dead-lift. He growls as he strains to lift the beam out o the way. Glass and T.J. jump in and go to work with toothbrushes and tweezers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reilly watches, fascinated, they uncover a scorched fragment of a briefcase handle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, baby, yes ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch throws Schnoz the red ball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good boy, Schnoz. Daddy loves you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scorch marks... looks like they used silly putty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly looks to Glass for an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C4, plastic explosive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva fuck factor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly again looks for an explanation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry, you'll pick it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, check this out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something glitters in the ashes. Pooch picks it up with tweezers. A tiny chip. The guys stare at it, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass takes it, puts on his magnifying spectacles, holds up to the light, frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.) Hardware.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Computer device?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unlikely. Probably, cash register or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and T.J. go back to searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.) What can you tell us about the girl with the exploding jewelry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass turns to see Reilly on his way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get back to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phones are ringing off the hook. Reilly bursts in, notice Winters directing an army of cops setting up sophisticate tracing equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go, we gotta jump on him the second he calls again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly discreetly crosses the room but is intercepted by Pluchinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PLUCHINSKY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were lucky today, vice boy. Captain said to leave it alone, but just remember, I'm watching you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, detective, but you're just not my type.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pluchinsky's face turns red with rage as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An OFFICER holds up a phone urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain, it's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room scrambles into action as Winters grabs the phone Swan's voice crackles over the squawk box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make me send another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we're prepared to talk, what do you want--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click, dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?   Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters slams down the receiver. Cops pull off their trac headphones, glance at each other uneasily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Section commanders, in my office, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the room erupts, Reilly turns to the BOOKING OFFICER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the girl? The one I brought in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs, interrogation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly takes off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wearing headphones connected to a tape recorder, a BORED flips wearily through a comic book in front of a one-way mirror. Through it can be seen a bare interrogation room where The Girl sits stubbornly at a table across from Har

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stubbing a butt into an overflowing ashtray, Harry rubs t back of his neck, gets up and goes through a door, into t viewing booth. The Bored Cop looks up, shuts off the tape recorder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hours. She's tough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough? Tough is "Fuck you, where's my lawyer?". This chick doesn't say boo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The outer door opens, Reilly walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bupkiss.    Sorry about Rice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly nods, accepts the condolence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain said I could give it a crack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She ain't no hooker.   This is a murder investigation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was my collar. Maybe I'll get lucky. But, if you got a problem with that, talk to the Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be in the can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry exits. The Bored Cop eyes Reilly suspiciously as Reilly crosses to the other door, yanks it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Reilly enters, The Girl stiffens at the sight of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly shuts the door, she doesn't respond. The Girl catc a glimpse of his 9mm under his trenchcoat, she's unfazed. paces, circling her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.) You know, your boyfriend just killed a ten year old at a bus stop, blew her head clean off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girl puts up a good front but we can see she's listen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.) You're scared. You're just caught in the middle. But, we've got a guy out there wasting people just to get you back. Why? It can't be because of your looks. So, I'll be honest with you -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly goes to the table, flicks off the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bored Cop doesn't notice, he's engrossed in his comic

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly sits, the Girl eyes him like a trapped prey. They' enemies, yet there's a strange chemistry between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me be very clear about this. The police won't let you go. When your boyfriend realizes this, I have a feeling a lot of innocent people are going to die. Kids, families. I know you don't want that to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares, eyes dark, barely registering any emotion at A flicker of fear, indecision. Her lips part, fighting it then she looks away, letting the fear win. Reilly flushes with anger, frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass squints through a microscope. Pooch sniffs and fumb dirt samples. T.J. rocks to a Walkman as he inspects the charred briefcase handle fragment. Bev is at her computer searching luggage websites on the Net.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly comes in, still frustrated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We missed you, where'd you go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before Reilly can answer, T.J. rips off his headphones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuckin A, I think I got two partial prints here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright!   How bout you, Glass, how's that chip shaking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look over.   Glass stares back darkly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, what is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong... this didn't come from any cash register.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whadaya mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's from an IRA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IRA - instant retirement account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I.R.A. device. Deadliest class of tickers in existence. Computerized, multiple sensors, booby traps, the works. First showed up in a series of I.R.A. bombings in London couple years ago. One of their boys tripped it on himself and they went back to a less complicated timers. The Girl, is she Irish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's not talking. But, she could be. So, obviously, you've seen one of these devices before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only once, at Redstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's one more time than any of the rest of us have seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.   We're fucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Relax, Pooch, it's just a ticker, it's not personal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's face it, we all knew it would happen sooner or later. The guy who can build a mousetrap that's better than we are ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. (points to Reilly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what's he doing to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up, T.J.!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be nice Pooch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all explode into a SHOUTING MATCH (except Glass who in his own world inspecting the microchip an inch from hi eyes). A moments mayhem until-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you, shut the fuck up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all go silent, stare at Reilly (except Glass).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No wonder the rest of the department doesn't want to work with you. You're nothing but a bunch of... punks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly goes to his Studebaker, climbs in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he starts it up, the passenger door rips open. jumps in, slams the door, furious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice performance back there. Where'd you learn that, Mike Ditka Sensitivity Seminar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, look--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you look, mister! First, you don't go calling my men names. It's bad for morale. Second, us "punks" happen to know a heck of alot more about police work than any vice cop ever did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah?     Prove it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) Drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass glares, a challenge.         Glaring back, Reilly g engine, screeches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Studebaker rumbles up to the machine shop, parks in t same haunting spot as the night before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Reilly climb out of the car, flashlights in han Reilly glances around, bad memories stirring up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place has already be combed. Forensics pulled over a hundred sets of prints inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's go see what they missed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling out a tool kit, Glass quickly picks the door lock yanks open the door, ducks inside. Reilly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nearly pitch dark inside, shafts of late afternoon sunlig glistens on the battered machines. Shadows wash over Reil and Glass as they retrace the path Reilly and Rice took t night before, Glass searching intensely, Reilly getting m and more uncomfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what were they doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. You tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An abandoned machine shop... nice place to build devices. Low rent, too. But, you and Rice ruined their perfect hideout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mentioned something called Redstone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Redstone's the army training center in Alabama where they send the cream of the crop to learn about tickers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cream of the crop, huh?   You?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (nods)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top of my class at West Point, thank you very much. Then off to Redstone. First half of the course we learned how to build devices... second half, we'd take them apart. Everything from firecrackers to hydrogen bombs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds like terrorist heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There were a few guys in my class with names like John Smith, Bill Jones. I'd see them up ahead in the hall, call their name, but they wouldn't turn around. C.I.A. Funny thing, they'd always disappear after the first half of the course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just how easy is it to build a... device?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a little training, you could go into a house and just from stuff in the bathroom and kitchen make something that'd finish off that alleged car of yours. Heck, didn't you ever watch MacGyver?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly looks at Glass strangely until he realizes they've stopped where Rice died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is where it happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly fights the memory... eyes well up, his hand trembl ever so slightly as he points out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girl was here. The guy in charge was over there with one of his men, the other one was back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass gets down on his hands and knees, scans the floor. Reilly talks to distract himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bombers, what kettle of fish are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical profile, usually losers, nobodies that're afraid to confront their victims. They like scaring people. That's why they call in their threats. Same mentality as obscene phone callers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Except they'll blow you up if you don't play along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, ninety-ninety percent of them are full of baloney. They're into the power trip, not the damage. What scares me is that this guy is so sophisticated he could blow up whatever he wants, then disappear. The worst of the bunch, they love the challenge of creating the wildest device ever... and they love the carnage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass lays out flat on his stomach and searches deep unde machine, picks up a half-smoked cigarette butt with tweez pulls it out, kneels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass straightens it out, reads the brand name, "Gallois"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: French. Doubt somebody who worked here smoked it. Only half gone, put it out in a hurry. (glances around) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.) Figuring the length, assuming it was one of these guys, odds are... it was lit outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass takes off.   Reilly follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and Reilly search the area.    Glass moves on his k aiming the flashlight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is where the van was parked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then, it's gotta be here somewhere ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's a longshot...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bingo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass pinches something with his tweezers, holds it up triumphantly... a used match.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A jungle of giant fibers teeming with strange molecules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No question, it was definitely the one used to l-light the butt. Finger pressure suggests a male, average build, height... no prints, trace of nylon fiber... he wore a glove.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. punches keys on a computer, peers through the micros as Glass, Reilly, Pooch and Bev stand by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two computer screens - one displays the magnified match f different angles, the other spills out a stream of formul and chemical breakdowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. (cont.) (reading info)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three foreign particles ... vulcanized rubber ... resin ... nitro-cellulose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nitro-cellulose. What is that, some kind of explosive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Industrial wood oil. Separately, any one of these things could lead in several directions, but together ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ka-Boooom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEV

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They make bowling balls out of vulcanized rubber ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Resin...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lane oil...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (beat, proud of his team)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bowling alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At an adjacent computer, Bev runs a scan program on the match, comparing it against an endless stream of match ty on file. Schnoz howls awake from a nap as T.J. stabs the screen as a match is made, specifications filling the scr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got it! Ace Match Company, Flint, Michigan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (amazed) You mean you just--? ... You keep a record of... matches?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, matches are a very big thing in our line of work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smirks at Reilly) "Punks", huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev, give `em a call, find out what bowling alleys they supply in this area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, why don't you e-mail your buddies at Langley and on the other side of the pond, see if any IRAs been popping up lately?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Reilly) We work fast enough for you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly mouth is opened, duly impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Studebaker and Harley swerve up to a run-down, window bowling alley, park in a red zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and T.J, climb out of the clunker, Glass off his b

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. checks his hair in the side mirror, sniffs his underarms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J., what're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first undercover assignment. I gotta look good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Glass exchange a grin, they drag T.J. inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A busy Saturday afternoon crowd. Rock music blasts, reverberating with the echo of crashing balls and pins. T lanes are teeming with sweating bodies. Sexy waitresses i skimpy outfits deliver drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. ogles women as they wander through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what're we looking for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone who smokes French cigarettes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this crowd? It's gonna be Marlboros, Camels, and maybe a few Kools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Glass nod, knowing it's a longshot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly directs Glass and T.J. to split up to case the pla

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They move through the rowdy crowd, eyes catching every smoker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music is more redneck-rock, the crowd as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and T.J. are in the midst of game of pool, nursing bottles of Root Beer. They continue to play while eyeing those coming and going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly enters from the alley, catches Glass' eye and shak his head. He goes to the bar and orders a coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He takes the drink and moves over next to Glass as T.J. l up a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long are we going to stay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Til we get a better lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly's attention is drawn to a crowded booth in the cor where a few bowling alley girls block the view of the ent booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass nudges Reilly, they look over to see Pooch entering bar. He sees them and moves to the bar. T.J. sinks his sh and lines up another as Reilly and Glass move to meet Poo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch produces a printout from his jacket, opens it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unsolved bombings in the last year... Boston, New York, Philadelphia... but no real match

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Political.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly my thinking. Except, none of the targets can actually be linked to government, political or special interest concerns. They seem to be just unrelated industrial companies.   Some insured, some not. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's traces of C4 and assorted inflammatory additives found in each case. The only common denominator is the detonators all had circuitry consistent with our micro- chip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad for Bomb squad, eh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What not bad. You've got a series of bombs, devices, that may or may not be connected, set by one or many nutjobs, who may or may not be linked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... it's more than we had ten minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a friend over at Scotland Yard who's gonna try and reach out to a undercover guy who would know if any of the rightwingers are circulating over here. Bev's following up on the briefcase manufacturers, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch, you're up.    Rack `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look over to the pool table to see only the cue ball left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boss, you're buying the next round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. sets his empty Root Beer bottle on the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How're you guys doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still waiting for a miracle.   Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and T.J. head back to the pool table where two come Gals have begun putting the balls back onto the table. T. turns on his smile and chats them up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite a team you've got, where'd you find them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a small fraternity, everyone knows everyone. I'm always recruiting. Pooch is ex- D.O.D., military expert... claymores, grenades. He played linebacker at Boston College, worked a K-9 unit - that led him to the Bomb Squad... great nose, lousy fingers, we try to keep him away from the tickers. T.J. is a heck of chemist, Texas A&M engineering degree. Found him in a Militia chat room - turns out we were both monitoring the same groups. Bev is the natural born hacker, we stole her from dispatch. She had the Cave reorganized and ultra-high-tech in two months. Captain has no idea how much hardware she's "found" for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys seem pretty tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've gotta be. In this business, you don't exactly make alot of outside commitments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, it's strange... it's not the best career path, but when you get the bug, there's nothing you can do about it.   See, when you beat one of these things... (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: there's that one second when you realize you saw something you weren't supposed to see... this beautiful naked woman... Death... and then the rush comes, the high, cuz you realize you got away with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. returns, shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lesbians.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch is still with the girls, showing one of them how to line up a shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like Pooch's doing okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's married, he don't even know what a lesbian is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. waves over the Bartender. He and Glass orders fresh drinks as Reilly eyes pretty Blonde across the bar. She picks up two beers and grabs a pack of matches off the ba

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns and moves to the booth in the corner.   The bod part and Reilly catches a glimpse of Earring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly nearly chokes on his coke as Earring takes the mat from the Blonde. Earring checks his watches, rises. He looks up and catches Reilly's eye - he smiles--then bolts

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly coughs up his drink and tries to get a word out, pointing as Earring slips out the exit door next to the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass pats Reilly's back as he gags, eyes blazing. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There he goes. He was here the whole time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly pushes his way through the crowd with Glass on his heels. T.J. rushes over and grabs Pooch away from the Gir at the pool table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly runs into a pair of enormous Rednecks, spilling th beer on them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rednecks grab him by the collar and prepare to fight Pooch arrives and body-blocks the Rednecks away from Reil

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly is released and he continues after Earring as Pooc and the Rednecks mix it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A brawl breaks out with Pooch and T.J. in the middle as Reilly and Glass make it to the exit door. Reilly flies o but Glass FREEZES dead in his tracks. He spins back to lo at the corner booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SHOPPING BAG sits on the floor under the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass tenses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fight escalates quickly, but Pooch employs his lineba skills and cuts down his assailant... and T.J. a natural streetfighting-rabbit-puncher. They quickly dispatch the Rednecks, leaving them bruised and bloodied... they rush Glass and the doorway--then lock on Glass' reaction and s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly runs out into the middle of the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the end of the block, Earring is rushing for the corne

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly draws his 9mm, aims thru the pedestrian--and fires

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earring is blown off his feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hits the pavement hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly enters and sees Glass, TJ and Pooch gathered aroun the booth in back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, thanks for the back up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bomb squad ignores Reilly, who now realizes something wrong. He pushes his way through the bar patrons to the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass glances up at Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He set one, the son-of-a...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ and Pooch exchange looks--they've never heard Glass so close to swearing before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. notices a small crowd starting to gather around the booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) Clear the area, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (loudly) You heard him, get the fuck away, it's a bomb!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That does it, the crowds shriek and scatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rolling eyes at each other, the Bomb Squaders turn their attention to the shopping bag sitting on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.   Let's assess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team eyes the package for a moment...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass makes a determination, whips out a knife, slashes t bag open, revealing a computerized nightmare of a bomb inside.   T.J. rubs his temples with dread.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TJ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass puts on his magnifying spectacles, starts to probe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch tests hinges with his tweezers. T.J. hands Glass a crimp. Pooch pries off a back panel, fingers shaking, lif it every so slightly, sees complex circuitry inside, the glow of a digital readout counting down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH
