dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck factor ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, I'm going in, nobody breathe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Synchronizing his chronometer to the counter, Glass begin disengaging sensor switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Altimeter... choking coil... mercury switch...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He clips off circuits and booby traps with bloodcurdling care, peeling away layer after layer of death... shakes h head with awe, respect, fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Triple V.O.M... brilliant... this guy's a master...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally he comes to the heart of the bomb, a pair of tiny wires leading to the blasting cap, one yellow, one red. Precious seconds tick away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's one of these wires.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So cut both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One shuts it down, one turns arms it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one's which?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. There's an old saying, when in doubt, cut the yellow wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly gulps. The device teeters, slightly, alarming T.J. and Pooch. Glass nods. T.J. and Pooch each grab a corner the device to steady it. Reilly follows their lead and kneels, goes to reach for a corner as well, one hand star to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can go back to the van if you like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly focuses and wills his hands to steady.    He grabs corner and closes his eyes, mind over matter.    Sweat st as he concentrates like never before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and T.J. stare at the wires with intensity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 seconds, 14, 13,... Glass pulls out a clipper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 12, 11, 10... He eases the clipper into position.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9, 8, 7... He draws in a breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Closing his eyes, he clips the yellow wire.    Reilly's e snap open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counter stops on 4 - no explosion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and T.J. whoop and hug like drunk madmen.   Glass s away, stone-faced. Reilly follows him, wobbly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.) You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Is this a great job or what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two squad cars have appeared, Officers cordon off the cri scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass watches Reilly kneeling over Earring's body digging through Earring's pockets, finding nothing but cash, cigarettes and matches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at Glass) Nothing. Nothing traceable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and T.J. have the device on the ground a few feet a from the Earring's body. They delicately continue to take apart so it can be transported safely. Schnoz sits nearby watching. Pooch is on the phone with his wife...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, honey. I'll see. No, everything's fine, it was nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he says this, he lifts a chunk of C4 and sets it aside Pooch hangs up his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and TJ exit the bar, moving to Glass and Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH (cont.) You guys hungry? The wife's got a heap of lasagna leftover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (at Reilly) What do ay say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg's lasagna. Good eats, Reilly.      C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass notes Reilly's hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.) Good meal would go a long way to steady your system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got work to do, don't we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch scribbles down an address on a scrap of paper from device's shopping bag, hands it to Reilly, offering a smi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In case you change your mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly looks at it awkwardly, then walks away as a News v arrives on the scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly cruises into the bowels of downtown.    Makes a fe turns and parks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadows of a burned out building, Reilly observes several JUNKIES getting a fix from their CONNECTION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly watches with scared, tempted eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at his hands... they're trembling... catches his reflection in the rear view mirror. Checks Rice's watches his wrist, taps it. Still not ticking. Ashamed, he screeches away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A quiet Squad Room. Reilly bangs out something on a compu terminal. He blazes away, typing as fast as he can. He holds out his hands. Almost steady. He takes a drink from Protein Shake, returns to typing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A weary Winters looks up from coffee and paperwork as Rei knocks, walks in. Reilly drops a sheaf of papers on his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report on the case so far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know after a shooting I would normally take your badge and weapon, but Glass called in already and confirmed it was clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But from now on, any leads on this case go to Pluchinsky. He's primary investigator and you are unofficially assigned to the Bomb Squad... you and your new friends are not to be playing detective any more. Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly nods, accepting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.) I imagine as soon as they find out one of their's is dead, we'll be getting another call. So get some sleep, alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly nods, turns and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT on a TV - a pretty Reporter reports live from the scene...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To recap, a gunman carrying what police described as a phony bomb was shot and killed less than an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan watches the TV report with Beard, eyes narrowing as sees Reilly in the crowd behind the Reporter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REPORTER (cont.) While the man's motives and identity remain a mystery, police are denying the incident is related to the explosion that ripped through a bar earlier today, killing 15 and wounding more than 30...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan kicks in the TV, destroying it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She talked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan flips open a suitcase full of bomb-making materials begins to sort through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, cozy, middle class. The Harley and the Bomb Squad are parked out front. Also the Studebaker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly exits the bathroom, returns to the dining room whe the Bomb Squad is laughing, hoeing and haying over desser Pooch's faithful wife, MEG, pours coffee. TOMMY and JANIE Pooch's kids, sit on Pooch's and T.J.'s knees, in their pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More coffee, T.J.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks, Meg. Hawed Pooch ever get so lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEG

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Reilly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike.   No thanks, I'm fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: POOCH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for bed, kiddos.   Say goodnight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TOMMY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can Uncle Teej tuck us in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, champ, I'll even give you a piggyback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JANIE (to Glass, Reilly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Goodnight Uncle Charlie, goodnight Uncle Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janie surprises Reilly with a shy kiss, scurries upstairs with after Pooch, T.J. and Tommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Night...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meg clears the dishes, Schnoz is asleep on the floor. Gla and Reilly are left alone.   Reilly takes a sip of coffee hand trembles ever so slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long were you hooked?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly stares, then opens up slowly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pittsburgh, two years ago. Partner died, no back-up, I was too gung-ho. As usual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take a tip from the Bomb Boys, always assess, if only for a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. I was working a drug ring, deep cover. Played the part too well. When they pulled me out, I wasn't a cop anymore. My fiance had dumped me. Next thing I knew, I was out here on the street, doped up, auditioning for the morgue when this tough old vice cop found me, cleaned me up, gave me a second chance. He promised Captain Winters he'd look out for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (nods sadly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess I didn't realize how much I needed him. He kept me straight. It's been tough every second since.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly holds up his wristwatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This was his. Doesn't work for shit, but it's keeping me straight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly gives him the watch. Glass pulls out a mini tool k pries off the back of the watch examines the works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.) Main spring's stuck. All you have to do is free the palate and realign the balance wheel. Here, you try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I terrible with mechanical things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you're not, you just don't understand them. Here, do what I tell you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds out the mini-kit. Reilly takes it uncertainly, b follows Glass' instructions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.) Okay, first push the pin back with this. Good. Now while you keep it there, stick this in here and turn it slowly. Easy, that's it. Now let the pin go and line up the wheel. That should do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly gives it a tweak, looks at the watch, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations, you just built your first ticker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly throws Glass a surprised look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sunrise breaking. Reilly and Glass have their heads under the hood of the Studebaker, covered in grease, tools everywhere. T.J. sits behind the wheel. Pooch and Schnoz stumble out of the house to watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. guns the engine, the Studebaker purrs like a tiger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've created a monster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass glances at Pooch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.    Maybe they gave up, split town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't bet on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bustling activity...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly enters to find Glass, Bev, T.J. and Pooch busy at at each of their work stations. Glass moves over to watch Bev's computer screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the print coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One partial from the handle matches the suspect from last night. Name's Carl Taylor. Long record of arson, assault, the works. The other print - we got nothing from our data base or the FBI or CIA... still waiting for Interpol.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev enters another command... the computer goes to work a she turns to Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee, Mike?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks, Bev.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She smiles warmly. He smiles back, T.J. eyes them, slight jealous of the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone rings.   Bev answers it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.   He's here.   I'll tell him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BEV (cont.) Mike, Captain wants to see you right away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A strange, uncomfortable silence hangs over the squad roo Reilly weaves past cops smoking, drinking coffee, waiting They all stare at him. Especially Pluchinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly walks in. Winters gestures for him to take a seat he talks on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes ... no, of course not but ... yes, sir, I understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got a call from upstairs. They say you questioned the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's refused to say a word to anyone. What made you think you could get her to talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't.     But I had to try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, I think I've shown that I'm a patient man. Rice was your biggest fan and I've tried to honor him by giving you some slack. But you are very close to running out of slack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters lets this sink in, then holds up Reilly's report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I read your report. Impressive. I'd say it's got detective written all over it. But... you cross the line one more time... you're gone. Are we clear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, nods, shifts uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, that out of the way. The girl wants to talk to you, alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So get going, let's close this thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly bolts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly enters to find Harry and the Girl waiting for him. Harry looks the Girl over, nods at Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly nods, Harry exits.     Reilly sits down at the tab opposite her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Mary Jordan. We were hired to take out some industrial sites. Insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they weren't all insured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cover. (slowly, ashamed) It was suppose to be abandoned buildings, y'know. No one was suppose to get hurt. The night you busted us...We were checking to make sure there weren't any vagrants around. Scare them away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is he?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex Swan. My brother. The other two are called Taylor and Leveau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Taylor's dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She seems relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.) Where are they, Mary?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary takes a deep breath, eyes welling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is a motel downtown, near the Machine Shop... the Suncrest. Room 138.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my brother...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly rises and moves to her.   Their eyes linger a mome bond between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why tell me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People are dying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly nods and touches her shoulder, a light squeeze. turns and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An army of cops and squad cars out front, Pluchinsky sile directs a SWAT team to the door. Reilly and the Bomb Squa watch from a distance as they break down the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHOUTING, mayhem as the team floods into the room. Pluchinsky brings up the rear. After a beat, Pluchinsky r emerges, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan and Beard watch from behind a car. Beard gives Swan dirty look and they quietly move off around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Glass are visibly disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the others grumble about it, Reilly notices someone ac the street - the Bag Lady with the pie-tin crown, holding hand out to a MAN getting into his car. The Man ignores h screeches off. The Bag Lady scribbles down his license number in her pad. Glass follows Reilly's stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ex-girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly crosses the street, intercepts the Bag Lady as she pushing her cart away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me... I'm looking for two men who were staying at the hotel over there - one has a beard, the other's tall, thin. You wouldn't happen to have seen them, would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAG LADY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, of course not... well, thanks anyway. Here you go, Your Highness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He fishes some change out of his pocket, hands it over, starts away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On second thought, maybe I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns back. The Bag Lady flips through her pad, stabs entry with her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme see... yeah, here it is, 11:18 this morning. Very disrespectful. He used to drive a van, but he got a new car. You want the license number?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tears off the page, holds it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're beautiful!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly gives her a big kiss, races back to the Bomb Squad who've been watching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're back in business!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look at him like he's nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Buzzing with action.   Harry and Pluchinsky attack Winter with printouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ran the license plate - car was rented early this morning from a Hertz office downtown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex Swan - demolitions expert, trained at Redstone, dropped out, freelanced in the middle East for awhile, then disappeared, no criminal record. The other one, Leveau, is French Canadian, he's a mercenary, record in half a dozen countries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out an APB, now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry moves off to the DISPATCHER as a fax machine comes life on the desk next to PLUCHINSKY. A fax spews out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.) Jesus. Pluchinsky, get four squad cars out to my house, get my family out of there, tell my wife I'm on my way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cops race to their cars. An armada of black-and-whites scream out of the parking lot. Winters appears and jumps into his Ford Sedan and tears out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... suspects driving a dark green Ford Grenada, license number one Two Eight Michael Vincent Edward ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Squad cars roar up and down the streets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two cars are parked out in front of one house in particul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the squad room, Pluchinsky and some men wait anxiously phones, computer-consoles, radio switchboard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly idles in his Studebaker. T.J. and Pooch come out o the parking lot in the Bomb Squad Van, Glass motors along side Reilly. He guns the bike and takes the lead, followe by Reilly, then the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They pull out into traffic and head towards the suburbs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard drives, Swan rides shotgun.   A briefcase lies on t seat between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he makes a left, Beard notices the Bomb Squad Van comi the other direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan whirls, pulls a gun as Glass and Reilly pass them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly double-takes...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly grabs his radio mic, yells into it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, there they are. Pooch right in front of you, you got `em, you got `em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly SKIDS to a dead stop. Glass, up ahead tries to maneuver around slowing cars as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grenada speeds down a street right in front of the Bo Squad Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch cranks into a turn and gives chase. Reilly and Glas are pinned in by other cars. They both finally squeeze ou of their jams in different directions...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited T.J. jumps on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch, this is Bomb Squad. Suspects sighted on Fern Street, two blocks from HQ. In pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Roger that.   All available units...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard speeds around another corner, the lumbering Van has difficulty keeping up and loses sight of the Grenada for moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grenada speeds up, heading towards the Police Station ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bomb Squad Van appears and speeds up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan stands discreetly in a phone booth, watching as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard steers towards a parked Squad Car next to the Stati on collision course. At the last second, Beard dives from moving car, hits the pavements and rolls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grenada CRASHES into the Squad Car... but no explosio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bomb Squad Van SKIDS to a stop as two uniformed Offic rush out of the Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard has rolled to his feet and is now sprinting off dow the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch and T.J. jump out of the Van (leaving a BARKING Sch inside) and sprint towards the Grenada, guns drawn. Pooch quickly huffing and puffing. T.J. continues after Beard a Pooch moves towards the Grenada. The uniforms follow T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass on his Harley appears from behind the Van. At the f end of the street the Studebaker rumbles into view, follo by a Squad Car, lights flashing. Everyone closing in on Beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. aims and yells at Beard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police, freeze!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard whirls around, SPRAYING automatic weapon FIRE at T. and the Uniforms - they hit the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A few nearby Pedestrians SCREAM and drop to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly jumps out of his Studebaker as Beard turns his FIR him, BLOWING OUT his windshield.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back at the Grenada, Pooch ducks for cover by the open driver's door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass runs his Harley behind a parked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Squad Car behind Reilly SKIDS to a stop and as Beard shifts his aim, T.J. and Reilly each PUMP TWO SHOTS into Beard's torso.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beard spins around, drops - dead silence on the street. Relief all around. Everyone stands back up. T.J.'s jaw drops at the sight of actually having hit the suspect wit his bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pooch exhales in relief, then hears BEEPING coming from t front seat of the car. He looks in to see the briefcase open, countdown ticking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... damn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Grenada explodes in a massive FIRE-BALL, throwing nea Glass off his feet. Everyone else drops back to the groun covering their heads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan grins and walks away down an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can hear the CRY of Schnoz, WAILING from the front sea Van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly stares off into space. Surreal silence, like a dream... Reilly looks at his watch, keeps his eyes low as steals a glance at Glass in the other chair, face wracked with pain, loss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both look through the glass office at the squad room outside, the sounds of reality fade in... phones ringing, voices shouting... a tense, chaotic emergency atmosphere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Glass rise as Winters walks in, closes the doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sits behind his desk, lights a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass, sorry about Pooch, he was a good man. We don't have time to give you a break right now, we're going ahead and-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God, you're going to use her, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Reilly) Glass, you're to stand by with your team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised her she'd be safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's our only option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It won't work, he'll know it's a trap...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, you're done for now. What the hell were you thinking directing the Bomb Squad Team into hot pursuit. They had no business-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been at the center of two suspect fatalities and two Police Officer fatalities. I'll need your badge and your weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly looks at Glass, there'll be no stepping in this ti He glares at Winters, reaches into his jacket, pulls out badge and tosses it on Winter's desk. He pulls out his 9m pops out the clip and open the chamber, sets it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Glass trudge out, both profoundly disturbed as they head across the squad room. Glass veers off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass--!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly stares, eyes wet, watching him disappear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glancing over, he notices Bev and T.J. sitting with Meg d the hall, Tommy and Janie asleep in her lap. Schnoz walks to Meg, whimpering.   Bev wraps her arm around her. T.J. puts his hand on Bev's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pluchinsky brushes roughly past Reilly, snapping him out it. He turns, walks dejectedly out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An armored van screeches up. Doors fly open. Metro SWAT Team jumps out with equipment, helmets, rush into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thundering silence. Winters and his men wait by phones. Their watches tick. So does the clock on the wall. Nothin SWAT Team Captain BENSON, huddles with his men.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone rings, shattering the quiet.   Harry answers it, it up urgently.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters takes it. A new high-tech TRACER flicks on a new piece of equipment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan's voice comes over the squawk box, growling low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You motherfuckers, you don't learn, do you?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're prepared to talk-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up!    Shut up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Tracer homes in on the signal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have exactly thirty minutes to release the girl where you found her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do we know you'll keep your word?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Click, dial tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters flashes a look at the Tracer.   The Tracer yanks his headphones in utter frustration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to his men) Okay, let's move!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room erupts into action. Benson and the SWAT Team are the first ones out the door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hauntingly familiar. An unmarked police car pulls up and stops behind the machine shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits behind the wheel.    Mary sits in the back, handcuffed to Pluchinsky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pluchinsky unlocks the cuffs.   Mary's eyes flare

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out and go to the machine shop -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary steps out of the car. She glances around--then heads the opposite direction of the Machine Shop. Pluchinsky curses. He starts to go after her, but realizes he'd bett clear the area. He peals out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undercover Men in various disguises track her from cars, on foot, communicating by hidden mics. A WINO eyes her carefully, lifts a bottle to his mouth and whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's out of the bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary exits the alley onto the street, searching where to She turns down the street and moves fast, eyes darting ab

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT van is tucked into an alley...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters, Benson and Team monitor the radio communication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the radio) Position Four. Turning on Elm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary crosses the street, a Camero nearly clips her. She makes it safely to the sidewalk and passes a TRUCK DRIVER eating a hot dog. After she moves off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaks into sleave) Six.   She's crossing to Main.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary looks around quickly, blends into a crowd coming out a store and ducks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRUCK DRIVER (cont.) She just went into a department store.    She's out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters grabs the mic...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seal the building! (to Benson) Let's move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT van RUMBLES to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary bolts through the store, ducks through a service doo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary bursts out, runs like a spooked horse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she dashes to the mouth of the the alley, she runs sma into the Camaro that almost hit her. It SCREECHES to a st The passenger door flies open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary leans down and looks in, flushes. It's Swan.    He reaches over and yanks her inside, TEARS away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Truck Driver runs into the other end of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to give chase as Swan tosses a small package ou the car. The Truck Driver dives for cover as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KA-BOOOOM!!!   A dumpster EXPLODES.   The Truck Driver ju his feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into sleave) We have contact. Black Camaro-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Van SPEEDS up as we hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -license number HQW-256.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From every direction, unmarked cars, squad units and the Van converge on the area.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan drives with deadly confidence, glances at Mary tende

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.   I warned them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He swerves left, then right, pulling a transmitter out of pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Security.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He sets a dial to 10, pushes a button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The transmitter counts down... 9, 8, 7...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Camaro tears down a one-way alley going the wrong way

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Undercover vehicles race after the Camero, seconds behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They swerve into the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then just as Swan whooshes out, a charge EXPLODES a stack 55 gallon drums. They fall down into the path of the pursuers who crash into the FLAMING DRUMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lead car EXPLODES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary looks back in horror as she's whisked away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, filthy, last stop to nowhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drunk, dejected, looking like shit, Reilly waits for a fi with a couple other JUNKIES. The TV in the bar drones in background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dealer appears and gestures to Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, cowboy, you're next.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly trudges over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, what's it gonna be? I got China White, Snow Flake, Ivory Pearl...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly looks up sharply as he hears the TV, visible throu the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're coming to you live near the scene of that latest, explosion that ripped through a downtown alley less than half an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something clears behind Reilly' eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impatient) Hey, asshole ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Despite growing fears and talk of a coverup, police have sealed off the area and are refusing to comment about fatalities, or the rumor that terrorists may be involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly's eyes shift, mind racing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I'm talking to you--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly himself again, Reilly bolts up, sending the Deal and his equipment scattering, and streaks off. He bursts of the front door of the bar into the glare of sunlight.. can hear SIRENS not too far off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving like a maniac as usual, Reilly grabs the radio mi with one hand, pulls his back-up .357 out of the glove-bo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens out the window for the SIRENS, he looks up at sound of approaching HELICOPTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the service bay, a MECHANIC raises the black Camaro on hydraulic lift, out of sight from the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out front, Swan pays an ATTENDANT, climbs into an orange Haul truck with Mary, drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, a squad car and an unmarked speed past the Gas Station.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan brushes Mary's hair from her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hungry?     We could get something to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary shakes her head, scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... just tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She forces a smile. Swan frowns suspiciously as he turns down a service road, pulls into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan pulls up to the loading dock of the warehouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are we stopping here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're moving' on. I have to pick up the supplies. Just two little boxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary turns white.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No...   No more killing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the truck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets out, disappears into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary glances around desperately, sees a phone booth at th corner. She looks back at the warehouse, the phone again, terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yanking her door open, Mary dashes to the booth, searches pockets. Empty. She dials zero... it rings and rings, the finally...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPERATOR (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Operator.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the police!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPERATOR (O.C.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this an emergency?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! Please, hurry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary's back is to the warehouse as she waits forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERGEANT'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police, Sergeant Doyle speaking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, I need help, my name is--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERGEANT DOYLE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa, slow down, lady. Now what's that again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly Mary sees the reflection of a face in the phone booth glass. She whirls - Swan is standing behind her!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you calling, sis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?    Nobody, I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She tries to hang up.   Swan grabs the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex, please-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! (into phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERGEANT DOYLE'S VOICE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sergeant Doyle, Metro P.D. Look, what's going on--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan's eyes turn cold, SLAMS down the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan grabs Mary, dragging her with him.   A pair of TEENA BOYS on skateboards notice, veer over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BOY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan whips out his Mac-11. The Boys skate for cover as Sw drags Mary back to the U-Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The open back door reveals a number of 55 gallon drums, s boxes and two milk crates of C4. He SLAMS down the slidin door, moves around front and shoves Mary inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught in traffic, map spread out in his lap, Reilly slam his horn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, move it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His police radio crackles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All units, 211 reported at 8th and Sycamore. Suspect is a Caucasian male, armed with an automatic weapon, last seen heading east with female hostage in a U-Haul truck ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly perks up, checks his map.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jamming the wheel, he crashes out of traffic, ripping the bumper off the car in front of him, and rockets away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He grabs his mic, thinks, disguises his voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch, this is Reilly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patch me through to the Bomb Squad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aren't you on suspension?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly runs a red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J., it's Reilly, put Glass on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. is in the passenger seat, Bev sits in the back with Schnoz, Glass drives. Glass takes the mic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you guys at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Driving in circles, waiting for-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Catch that alert? That's him in the U-Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cuz he got the girl, now he's leaving town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Should we head for the Interstate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'd slip out past the hotel district, behind Greyhound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly hangs up, fishtails around a corner, map blowing o the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrol cars, unmarked and the SWAT Van criss-cross the streets in confusion...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. speeds by in the Bomb Squad van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly swerves onto 8th Street, eyes searching desperatel

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rounding the rear of a huge glass luxury hotel, Reilly catches a glimpse of orange disappear around a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly bangs a hard right to go around the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) Glass, Eighth Street, alley behind Grand Hotel. Cut him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) You got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bomb Squad accelerates...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly changes channels on the radio...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) All units, suspect spotted heading down alley behind Grand Hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (cont.) (beat) We need back-up, now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters is shocked at the sound of Reilly's voice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic) Reilly, what the hell are you-?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on radio) Fire me later. Close in and we got the bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull back.   You're only an observer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly throws down his mic, aims at the alley ahead and speeds up, then cranks into the alley, SCREECHES to a sto

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The U-Haul barrels down the alley. Swan sees Reilly up ah get out of his car and aim his .357

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan SLAMS on the brakes. Throws the vehicle into reverse Checks his mirror to see the Bomb Squad Van appear at the of the alley. He's completely pinned in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and T.J. jump out, they are in bullet-proof vest, aiming shotguns, using the van as a shield. Bev jumps out with Schnoz and slips behind the van entirely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly's radio CRACKLES...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, what's happening? Reilly! Reilly! Do not engage. We're five minutes-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (into mic) We'll keep him pinned in, you guys hurry up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly throws done the mic, takes aim again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: idles.   Swan's rage erupts.       He climbs out with Mar

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly aims carefully...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan keeps his Mac-11 to Mary's head. Reilly is frozen by move. Swan backs to the rear of the van. He slides up the door, revealing the drums and explosives to the Bomb Squa He reaches in and grabs a remote control.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SIRENS are coming closer, only a block or two away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass and T.J. drop their jaws.       They see Swan depre remote, arming the explosives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS Reilly!    He's loaded!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY (yelling) Glass, you guys take cover, goddammit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN I want out, right now.      Or the whole city block is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, he's got enough to do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly leaves the cover of his car and scurries along the side of the alley, escaping Swan's view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan rages.   He moves around the van, pulling Mary along

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan SPRAYS a FLURRY of bullets over Reilly's head... Rei dives for cover as bullets rip the alley wall inches from face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan whirls and SPRAYS the Bomb Squad Van, dropping T.J. a shot to the leg. Bev drops to his aid. Glass grimaces, having been hit in the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly moves forward about to take the shot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly, don't. He's got a pressure switch. He releases it, we're done for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan turns back to Reilly, rams his Mac-11 to her throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SWAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MARY (to Reilly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take him!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary jerks away from Swan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly fast FIRES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swan takes Reilly's SHOTS in the chest. He smiles as he starts to fall, his hand starts to open up to release the detonator...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary dives onto Swan and grabs at the remote, clasping it her hands. Swan collapses, Mary on top of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Glass sprint at the U-Haul, reaching a trembli bleeding Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She clinches her jaw, fighting the grief, holding on to t remote.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly reaches Mary first and puts his hands over her's - looks up into his eyes--distraught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on to that thing tight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass goes to the explosives and looks over the set-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Fucking H. Christ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly has never heard Glass swear before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck factor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the scale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass turns to Mary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you hold it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She nods.   Reilly releases her gently, joining Glass at van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me.     Let's assess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass stares at the digital read-out on the device anchor in one of the C4 crates. It reads: "1:30, 1:29..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, talk to me! We can do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He has a timer going as back-up, in case we got a hold of the remote. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... first, run your fingers along the edges, feel for a sensor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly does it the way he saw Glass do it before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good, now the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's go in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly feels around, finally finds an access hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly works the hole bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not enough time ... gotta go for the blasting cap. Only one chance... hand entry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close your eyes, feel your fingertips.   Tell me everything you feel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly' hand disappears into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His fingers snake through complex circuitry as he describ each layer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wires... metal, cold... something soft...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The red digital numbers keep counting down: 0:38, 0:37, 0

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More metal... sharp edge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay to your left.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Deeper, deeper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SWAT Van and a unit arrive, Winters and Benson jump o the SWAT Team is about to follow-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get outta here, Swan's down, but they're chilling a device.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters looks to the action at the U-Haul, sees Reilly an Glass busy at work. He nods at Benson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally Reilly' fingers touch a button object. We hear th SWAT Van and the unit retreat at the end of the alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something round, two wires ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the blasting cap - good! Okay, now grab it by the base and pull it straight up. No, Wait...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too easy. There's gotta be something else in there, another cap maybe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make up your mind, trigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ease your thumb over to the right - feel anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly eyes shift as his hidden fingers feel around...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, another round thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, one of the caps turns it on, the other shuts it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one's which?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When in doubt, pull the yellow wire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How the hell do you feel yellow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No excuses, just do it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 10... Reilly glares at Glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 9... His face is dripping with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 8... His fingers shift back to the first cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 7... They close over it, ready to pull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 6... But then they stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 5... Reilly frowns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 4... Glass stabs him with a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 3... 2... Lightning-quick, Reilly' fingers fly back and y the second cap out of its base.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The counter stops.    0:01.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Glass and stare at it, holding their breath, hardly daring to believe it's true. They whoop and explod with relief.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's over... it's finally over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not bad, for a rookie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REILLY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly and Glass turn to Mary who has lost consciousness is still holding the remote tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass looks up to see T.J. and Bev peeking from around th van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All clear, but we need an ambulance!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bev jumps into the van to make the call as T.J. starts limping towards the U-Haul. Schnoz yelps and drops from t van and runs for the U-Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly cradles Mary in his lap as Glass kneels and remove the remote - the red light stops flashing, then turns off

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. arrives and looks down at Reilly and Mary, then at t device in the U-Haul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room is back to its usual bustling activity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters is going through reports on his desk as Reilly enters. Reilly is cleaned up, shaven, haircut, new suit.. new man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters look up, impressed with the change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mayor loves a hero.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters hands Reilly an envelope and a new badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WINTERS (cont.) Just want you wanted. Your promotion, and transfer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, Captain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Winters nods and goes back to his paperwork.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. and Bev work closely together on a mock-device. T.J. teaching her the job. They smile warmly at each other. Glass is on the computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J. flinches, but she winks at him to calm him down. smiles... no longer threatened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass doesn't look up from his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass points to the work station next to him where a Bomb Squad Protocol Program is waiting on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reilly smiles and he sits next to Glass, hands him the transfer papers envelope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GLASS (cont.) (softening) Welcome to the family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glass accepts the papers and shakes Reilly's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That feeling won't last long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: T.J., Glass and Bev start laughing.   After a beat, Reill joins in heartily.
